Because control plane vms cannot be scaled in, hence this question is asking about worker vm.

Selected Answer: C
It should be C, IMHO. C. Worker node count

You can scale out a Tanzu Kubernetes cluster by increasing the number of worker nodes using kubectl.
Locate the spec.topology.workers.count parameter and increase the number of nodes.

questions.question_text: Which two items must be provided before a vSphere with Tanzu Supervisor Namespace can be created? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
I'm lost. The documentation requires a VSphere with Tanzu cluster, a DNS compliant hostname AND storage policies. 

A, B, and D are all correct.

correct Answer: AB
Only this option

Selected Answer: AB
AB looks right answer

Selected Answer: AB
Answer is A and B, the other option can only be created after the namespace is ready

comments.content: You can create a Storage Policy prior to creating a namespace. You just can't associate it until the namespace is created. In the documentation, it lists Storage Policy as a pre-requisite.
Yes, but it can be also added after creating the namespace. But DNS complaint name should be before, so I too vote for AB.
I agree with this reasoning, I'll put a voting commend for AB as well.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Prerequisites:
Configure a cluster with vSphere with Tanzu.
Create users or groups for all DevOps engineers who will access the namespace.
Create storage policies for persistent storage. Storage policies can define different types and classes of storage, for example, gold, silver, and bronze.
...

questions.question_text: Which two considerations needs to be made when deciding on a virtual machine class type during the process of creating a Tanzu Kubernetes cluster? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A and C is correct

Selected Answer: AC
Given answer is correct

choices.A: Whether the resources provided by the virtual machine class type should be reserved on the host
choices.C: The amount of CPU, memory, and storage the virtual machine should have
choices.D: Connectivity between the Tanzu Kubernetes cluster and the Subscribed Content Library
choices.E: The storage classes which need to be made available to the cluster
choices.B: The configuration parameters which need to be edited in the cluster
